intro: Griffinia concinna, commonly known as the pink fairy tern, is a small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces bright pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
